[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: derive_decryption_key_share() trait method] [Delegate validation gap] Does this wrapper at line 368 add any additional validation beyond calling msk_share.derive_decryption_key_share(), or can attackers exploit the lack of extra checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: reconstruct_decryption_key()] [Share authenticity bypass] Are the shares validated to be from authorized players before reconstruction, or can an attacker include shares from non-participants? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: reconstruct_decryption_key()] [Duplicate share exploitation] Can an attacker provide duplicate shares from the same player multiple times in the shares slice, potentially breaking the Lagrange interpolation or threshold calculations? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: reconstruct_decryption_key()] [Weight miscalculation] Does the reconstruction properly account for weighted players' shares, or can incorrect weight calculation allow reconstruction below the true threshold? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Parallel execution race condition] Does the into_par_iter() at line 383 introduce race conditions where concurrent prepare() calls on ciphertexts could corrupt shared state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Digest reuse attack] Can the same digest be used across multiple prepare_cts calls for different batches, enabling cross-batch decryption attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Proof availability attack] What happens if eval_proofs doesn't contain proofs for all ciphertexts in cts at line 384 - does prepare() fail gracefully or can this enable partial decryption attacks? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Error aggregation vulnerability] Does the collect at line 385 stop on first error or try to prepare all ciphertexts, and can partial failures leave some PreparedCiphertexts in exploitable states? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: prepare_cts()] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker provide a large cts array that causes excessive memory allocation in the parallel iterator, leading to OOM and node crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Key reuse vulnerability] Can the same decryption_key be safely reused across multiple decrypt calls at line 392, or does this enable correlation attacks on plaintexts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Parallel decryption race] Does the parallel iterator at line 392 properly isolate decryption operations, or can concurrent access to decryption_key cause race conditions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Type confusion attack] Can an attacker exploit the generic Plaintext type parameter to cause type confusion by requesting decryption to incompatible plaintext types? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Partial decryption leak] If some ciphertexts fail to decrypt at line 394, does the function leak information about which specific ciphertexts failed, enabling oracle attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Error timing attack] Can an attacker use timing differences in decryption failures to infer information about the decryption key or plaintexts? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/schemes/fptx_weighted.rs] [Function: decrypt_individual()] [Proof-digest binding] Does prepare_individual() verify that the eval_proof was generated for the provided digest, or can proofs be reused across different digests? (Critical)
